messages.message: Feedback from a peer. They abandoned the product because they followed the path for ‘external storage’, and abandoned because they don’t have S3. The ‘upload files’ should be the primary call to action, ‘browse external storage’ should be made to be subordinate and we could add clarity that external means S3.
Thanks for this. External means S3 or Google Drive for now. I agree that uploading directly should be the default

For what it’s worth this was a technical user, so they would have understood if we said ‘S3’. As it stands it takes 3 clicks on buttons that say ‘external storage’ before the user finds out that it means S3. This user was also unclear on what ‘external’ meant.

Also, if Google Drive is supported then I don’t see that as an option for external storage.
We turned off the feature for adding Google Drive to your account since we haven’t gotten integration approval from Google yet

@alagu could we get an updated design for this?

cc @Jessica @Junwon Jang
@Kerry since I'm already making a little change for Google Drive, is this something you'd like me to try to sneak in?

@alagu and I just chatted about this; she'll reach out to you Jessica. In this case, we both agree that this should be improved -- at the minimum, consistency is missing here (inconsistent use of button and text as links for the same kind of action -- for a user, it's all about adding files to a project).

Going forward though we should have a planned product release schedule, and should not push adhoc changes often anymore (even if they are good changes).
